documentation.purpose: This rule goes with ADVSR_VTE. Creates documentation on the clinical event table when the "Exit" or "Document" buttons are clicked on the html screen. For each clinical event, a text string is created summarizing information in the html window when the "Document" button was clicked and will be placed in the comment of the clinical event. The rule is triggered by a ccl program that calls the Discern Expert CPM server 175 to trigger this rule - information is sent through the paramters of that program that is used to provide the data for documentation. This rule goes through that data in the form of @MESSAGE:[] variables and creates the appropriate clinical events based on what data is sent from the html. Please see the spreadsheet included in the Supplemental Documentation section of the package for further information on building the events.
documentation.explanation:
The following is determined to be created when the "Document" button is clicked:
1) Create clinical_event to document the Risk Category determined. L4 - L15 and Action Group 1
2) Create clinical event to document if the patient had a Risk Factor. L16 - L21 and Action Group 2
3) Create clinical event to document if the patient had a Pharmacologic Contraindication. L22 - L74 and Action Group 11
4) Create clinical event to document if the patient had a Mechanical Contraindication. L75 - L84 and Action Group 3
5) Create clinical event to document if the patient had received heparin the last 100 days. L85 - L92 and Action Group 4
6) Create clinical event to document the recommendation type determined. L95 - L108 and Action Group 6
7) Create clinical event to document if the patient had an Other Mechanical Contraindication documented in the text box on the html screen. L109 & L110 and Action Group 7
8) Create clinical event to document if the patient had an Other Absolute Pharmacologic Contraindication documented in the text box on the html screen. L111 & 112 and Action Group 8
9) Create clinical event to document if the patient had an Other Relative Pharmacologic Contraindication documented in the text box on the html screen. L113 & L114 and Action Group 9
10) Create clinical event to document if the patient had an Other Patient Risk Factor documented in the text box on the html screen. L115 & L116 and Action Group 10
The following is created when the "exit" button is clicked:
Create clinical event to document the chosen deferral reason. L93 & L94 and Action Group 5
If you are implementing NHIQM VTE condition, dertain actions of this rule are sent back thru Discern Expert servers to trigger rule NHQM_VTE_ADVISORINT_1. If you are not implementing NHIQM VTE condition and this rule is not present in domain, all action templates can set the RESEND field to "do not" to avoid longer processing time.
documentation.impact:
**IMPORTANT SETUP INFORMATION - PLEASE READ***
For further set up instructions including test scripts, please refer to the Supplemental Documentation included within the Content Package.
EVOKE: E1 Do NOT modify TRIGGER name. This is a value set within the VTE Risk Assessment Advisor .html file. When the button is clicked in the Advisor to close the Advisor window, this value will be sent through to the server to trigger this rule.
LOGIC: L3 Do NOT modify the EXPRESSION parameter. This is looking to the request to find information sent from the VTE Risk Assessment Advisor .html file. When the Document button is clicked in the Advisor, information will be sent through to the rule.
Do NOT modify any EKS_EVAL_L templates.
L6, 8, 10, 12, 14, 18, 20, 24, 27, 30, 33, 36, 39, 42, 45, 48, 51, 54, 57, 60, 63, 66, 69, 72, 77, 79, 81, 83, 87, 89, 91, 97, 99, 101, 103, 105, 107. The paramvalue must be reinstantiated with client specific database build. (Please refer to the template documentation for assistance with this template) One parameter value can be copied from that referential help and then pasted into this template's parameter value.
All Action Groups:
EVENT_NAME parameter needs to be reinstantiated. Do NOT modify the OPT_COMMENT and OPT_COMMENT_TYPE parameters.
If you are implementing NHIQM VTE condition, dertain actions of this rule are sent back thru Discern Expert servers to trigger rule NHQM_VTE_ADVISORINT_1. If you are not implementing NHIQM VTE condition and this rule is not present in domain, all action templates can set the RESEND field to "do not" to avoid longer processing time.
********************************************** Modifications from Version 4 to Version 5 **********************************************
Between L24 and L66, EKS_BUILD_PARAM_L Templates have been added to modify the way this rule populates action template A11. These templates will need the PARAMVALUE field reinstantiated.
L117 and L118 were added to evaluate existing results for D-VTE Pharmacologic Contraindication, so any new results gathered during the rule evaluation can be added to those existing results.
L119 contains an evaluation to compare existing results for D-VTE Pharmacologic Contraindication with any incoming results for the same DTA, to determine if there are any new results.
L120 contains an added script that will add incoming results to existing results for D-VTE Pharmacologic Contraindication. Action Group 11 is now pointed at this script's logic template, which will decide if anything needs to be written out in A11. This script, nhqm_get_ce_coded_results, will need to be present in each domain in which this rule will be active.

templateDefinitions.name: EKS_SYNCH_TRIGGER_E
templateDefinitions.definition: the Expert Synch trigger is listed in TRIGGER.

statements.statement: select trigger_name="Double click in lower box to enter trigger name(s)" from (dummyt d with seq = 1)

templateDefinitions.name: EKS_STOP_LOGIC_L
templateDefinitions.definition: the following templates are false, MODE logic evaluation
templateDefinitions.description: Used to control efficiency of Action Group rules

templateDefinitions.name: EKS_PARSE_DYNAMIC_PARAMS_L
templateDefinitions.definition: Parse parameter string in PARAM_STRING for use in OPT_TEMPLATE_SECTION Template number OPT_TEMPLATE_NUMBER
templateDefinitions.description: Parse a string of dynamic parameters to be used by subsequent templates

statements.statement:
select action = if (d.seq = 1) "Logic" elseif (d.seq = 2) "Action" ENDIF, _hidden = if (d.seq = 1) "L" elseif (d.seq = 2) "A" ENDIF
FROM (DUMMYT D WITH SEQ = VALUE(2))

templateDefinitions.name: EKS_BUILD_PARAM_L
templateDefinitions.definition: ACTION a dynamic parameter named PARAMNAME with a value of PARAMVALUE. And OPT_SUBSTITUTION resolve substitution value.
templateDefinitions.description: Create or add to a dynamic parameter to be used by subsequent templates.

statements.statement:
select action = if (d.seq = 1) "Create" elseif (d.seq = 2) "Append To" ENDIF, _hidden = if (d.seq = 1) "1" elseif (d.seq = 2) "2" ENDIF
FROM (DUMMYT D WITH SEQ = VALUE(2))
select param_value ="Double click in lower box to enter a freetext value, or right click and paste values that have been copied", _hidden = " " from (dummyt d with seq = 1)

templateDefinitions.name: EKS_CE_RESULTA_MOST_RECENT_L
templateDefinitions.definition: the most recent result for EVENT_SET_NAME is EVALUATION VALUE1 for the same encounter as OPT_LINK over the last OPT_TIME_NUM OPT_TIME_UNIT

statements.statement: SELECT IF (PAR1="ALL") from nomenclature n,code_value cv plan cv where cv.code_set=401 and cv.cdf_meaning ="ALPHA RESPON" join n where n.active_ind=1 and n.principle_type_cd=cv.code_value and n.beg_effective_dt_tm <= cnvtdatetime(curdate, curtime3) and n.end_effective_dt_tm >= cnvtdatetime(curdate, curtime3) and n.source_string != " " ELSEIF (PAR1 != "OTHER") from nomenclature n,code_value cv plan cv where cv.code_set=401 and cv.cdf_meaning ="ALPHA RESPON" join n where n.active_ind=1 and n.principle_type_cd=cv.code_value and n.beg_effective_dt_tm <= cnvtdatetime(curdate, curtime3) and n.end_effective_dt_tm >= cnvtdatetime(curdate, curtime3) and n.source_string != " " and CNVTUPPER(n.source_string)=PATSTRING(CONCAT(cnvtupper(PAR1),"*")) ELSE from nomenclature n,code_value cv plan cv where cv.code_set=401 and cv.cdf_meaning ="ALPHA RESPON" join n where n.active_ind=1 and n.principle_type_cd=cv.code_value and n.beg_effective_dt_tm <= cnvtdatetime(curdate, curtime3) and n.end_effective_dt_tm >= cnvtdatetime(curdate, curtime3) and n.source_string != " " and CNVTUPPER(substring(1,1,n.source_string)) NOT BETWEEN "0" AND "Z" ENDIF STRING = n.source_string ORDER cnvtupper(n.source_string)

templateDefinitions.name: EKS_EXEC_CCL_L
templateDefinitions.definition: Execute PROGRAM_NAME with parameters OPT_PARAM and link to OPT_LINK

templateDefinitions.name: EKS_CE_CREATE_CODED_CE_A
templateDefinitions.definition: Create a STATUS, OPT_NORMALCY, EVENT_NAME result of VALUE1 OPT_UNITS_OF_MEASURE on the same encounter as LINK with OPT_COMMENT_TYPE of OPT_COMMENT and RESEND send this event back through Discern Expert. OPT_INHERIT_DYN_LABEL inherit the dynamic label, if one exisits.

templateDefinitions.name: EKS_CE_CREATE_CE_A
templateDefinitions.definition: Create a STATUS, OPT_NORMALCY, EVENT_NAME result of VALUE1 OPT_RESULT_UNITS (with OPT_NUM_DEC_PLACES decimal places) on the same encounter as LINK with OPT_COMMENT_TYPE of OPT_COMMENT and RESEND send this event back through Discern Expert.OPT_INHERIT_DYN_LABEL inherit the dynamic label, if one exisits.
